      Overloaded version of Finder.getQuery(String, boolean) always passing true in the second updateStats arg.
      YADAQuery Finder.getQuery(String q, boolean updateStats)
      A cornerstone to the entire YADA framework, this method takes the name of a stored query as an argument and returns a YADAQuery object containing the query code and default parameters, as well as data structures and methods to facilitate it's execution.
      YADAQuery Finder.getQueryFromIndex(String q)
      Retrieves the query q from the distributed index (i.e., database).

      Methods in com.novartis.opensource.yada.util with parameters of type YADAQuery 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Class<Adaptor> QueryUtils.getAdaptorClass(YADAQuery query) 
      boolean QueryUtils.isCommitQuery(YADAQuery yq)
      Returns true if the YADARequest.PS_COMMITQUERY parameter is not null, has a length > 0, equals true, and the query type is equal to Parser.INSERT, Parser.UPDATE, or Parser.DELETE
      boolean QueryUtils.isDelete(YADAQuery yq)
      Returns true if the query type matches Parser.DELETE.
      boolean QueryUtils.isInsert(YADAQuery yq)
      Returns true if the query type matches Parser.INSERT.
      boolean QueryUtils.isUpdate(YADAQuery yq)
      Returns true if the query type matches Parser.UPDATE.
      String QueryUtils.processInColumns(YADAQuery yq, int row)
      This method uses a variety of variables from yq to determine the number of jdbc positional parameters which must be included in the SQL in clause in the stored query.
      private void QueryUtils.processJDBCStatement(YADAQuery yq)
      Utility wrapper method to manage Parser instantiation and parsing.
      void QueryUtils.processStatement(YADAQuery yq)
      Called when the CCJSqlParserManager.parse(java.io.Reader) throws a JSQLParserException Uses regular expression to infer the query type.
      boolean QueryUtils.requiresConnection(YADAQuery yq)
      Test if the query requires a stored connection
      void QueryUtils.setProtocol(YADAQuery yq)
      Interrogates yq for the adaptor class and sets the protocol attribute accordingly.
      void QueryUtils.setQueryParameters(YADAQuery yq, int row)
      While processing JDBC statements, this method handles mapping of data values to JDBC positional parameters.
      void QueryUtils.setValsInPosition(YADAQuery yq, int row)
      This method creates a list for positional-indexed storage of data values, then iterates over the list of jdbc-parameterized columns, extracting the corresponding values from the data map.
